overview: This bill establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund and accounts under the fund to facilitate the administration of the fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the UH system. [10] This measure repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. [11] The university shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session, accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. [11]
agency_impact: On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the credit of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. [11] The university may establish accounts under the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund to facilitate the administration of this fund among the various campuses and operating units of the university of Hawaii system. [11] The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs. [11]
economic_impact: Your Committee finds that establishing a single revolving fund for all conference center activities will help to standardize conference center programs across all campuses of the University of Hawaii System and facilitate the administration of conference center moneys. [12]
policy_impact: Section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [11] Section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [11]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: Your Committee on Ways and Means has amended this measure by clarifying the permissible uses of moneys appropriated from the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund; and making technical nonsubstantive amendments for purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. [12] As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Ways and Means that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Third Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2. [12]
